tweet: @aoptic @elonmusk Yeah, I‚Äôm sure this likely happens on all social media platforms. Just like you have a right to know what happens to your PII on platforms, perhaps you should be told when a tweet or an account is being intentionally suppressed.   ‚ÄúThis tweet had its reach intentionally reduced.‚Äù
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: While this might bring more content into my timeline that I don‚Äôt agree with, I‚Äôm happy this is finally coming to light and changing for people who have been unfairly silenced or suppressed.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: Since then, I‚Äôve had tweets that have seen up to 2 million impressions and have gained 10k followers. What changed? I think we are just starting to learn how much bias was working against many on this platform for too long.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: A few weeks ago, something at Twitter changed. @elonmusk bought the platform and began to dismantle many aspects of it. One of those aspects changed how my own account started to behave when it came to reach and followers.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: Because of this, I‚Äôve been relatively quite on Twitter the past few years because knowing that a platform was actively working against you is demotivating to say the least.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: My follower count progressively started to drop over the next few years. 30k->25k->15k. IIRC, if bottomed out at about 10k. All the time, I was engaging in similar ways and getting no reach at all.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: I started to notice oddities with my Twitter account. I‚Äôd been engaged in discussion where my comments would get zero likes while those engaging with me would get dozens or even hundreds. I had many people I was personal friends with me they didn‚Äôt know why they unfollowed me.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: Some of the people I know that were involved in this worked at Twitter at one point in their career. Not going to name names here this is bigger than them.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: In 2013, I got involved in movements within the hacking community that certain people didn‚Äôt think that I or others involved had ‚Äúpermission‚Äù to work on. Some of those people started to meddle with my personal life, my home was broken into & trashed and tried to get me fired.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: From 2009 to 2012, I was very engaged on Twitter sharing insights into security issues and research my team at the time had been producing. I went from 0 to 30k followers pretty quickly.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: Until @elonmusk purchased Twitter and seemingly started to dismantle the unfairness on the platform, people who claimed they had been shadow-banned, removed from searches, or had followers removed were often told those features didn‚Äôt exist at Twitter. üßµ#TWITTERGATE
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: @SecBarbie @elonmusk @Twitter You can actually just look at the times of day and frequency of their tweets/replies to see that many of these folks can‚Äôt possibly doing anything productive.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: Over the last decade, I ran services at @rapid7, was the CSO at @Uptake and now run Security, IT & Engineering at a top 3 crypto exchange. It‚Äôs been a fun ride & the recent events have certainly been stressful and exciting. I‚Äôm optimistic about the future. Thanks for reading.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: Around 2012, I learned what Bitcoin was from the guys in @SpiderLabs because they were using the password cracking GPUs to mine & and I got wind of it. I was educated by those team members and became interested in learning more.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: In 2009, I created @thotcon - and along with @zfasel, @Sakebomb @Jaku @_videoman_ & @atucom ran a annual hacking conference in Chicago that will hold its 13th even in 2023. This con has had some of the best speakers from around for world on its stages.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: During this time, I also did security research & sponsored folks to do research as well. I had the opportunity to speak at @defcon about 10 times and the best stage to be on as a hacker. I‚Äôm also a Goon at @defcon as part of the NOC & run a contest @DrunkHackerHist.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: We tested, advised, consulted with and helped in security crisis situations some of the best brands on the planet. If you used almost anything popular in the 00s it was likely touched by @SpiderLabs to help secure it.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: Culturally this team was amazing. We were a global, diverse, passionate, brilliant group of people - and we never took ourselves seriously. In fact, pranks on epic scales were the norm and often played against me.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: After ISS, I joined Exault which was acquired by @VERISIGN and the I helped start up Ambiron which eventually became @trustwave. This is where I created @SpiderLabs - at it‚Äôs peak around 2011/12 was probably the best hacking team on the planet.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: I got the job and began the life of a traveling consultant installing firewalls, IDS systems and doing early penetration testing for brand name clients all over the county. Shortly after I joined, Netrex was acquired by Internet Security Systems.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: Around this time, my mother was very sick & eventually died from breast cancer. I was 23. On the day of her funeral, the landline of my bedroom rang. I wasn‚Äôt going to answer it, but I made a split second decision to. It was a recruiter at Netrex asking me to interview.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: While there I met @HermanVerkoff because we ended up on the same team together. Close to my 2 year mark, he left to join a company called Netrex. They were one of the first MSSPs and the largest reseller of @CheckPointSW at the time.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: I was a very unpolished kid coming out of school and working at @Accenture for 2 years was better for my growth & experience then getting a Masters - especially the people that I met.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: The only company that actually asked me what I wanted to do was @Accenture (known then as Andersen Consulting). I ended up working in an internal role at one of their offices in the Chicago area. I was out on a team that was exactly what I was interested in networking & security.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: Around the time I was graduating, most of corporate recruiters were looking to talent to help with the Y2K Bug. I flat out told recruiters that I had no interest in working on that problem which offended many and boxed me out of many high paying opportunities.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: I also worked with a professor to develop the university‚Äôs online classroom around 1995. It was all written in Perl CGI and was actually used to teach a class for education majors about the way school will be taught in the future. The futurist in me love working on this project.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: I was also involved with helping get my university ‚Äúget online‚Äù. I developed the first web presence for an number of departments including the Financial Aid Office to reduce the time & energy students needed to spend getting the money they needed to pay for their tuition.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: After high school, I attended @IllinoisStateU to major in computer information systems and minor in philosophy. I was also a member of the @isubrmm and played tenor saxophone. In college, I got sucked into the world of IRC and ran a EFNet IRC server with @sjwoodr.
name: Nick Percoco

tweet: There wasn‚Äôt a ton of students with similar interests, but fortunately there was one. @ktgeek and I worked together on writing videos games to rewriting utilities for the school to developing learning software for ESL students.
name: Nick Percoco
